Reviews.Title: Fantastic Buy!
Reviews.Author: Marielle "dragonpryf"
Reviews.Content: I love this phone!  I love all the 32GB internal memory, the expansion slot for the 64GB micro SD card and the 2GB of RAM.  I love the simplicity of the transfer of files from my old HTC Evo 3D to this new phone in 13 minutes.  Played with it all day, read my Kindle book for 2 hours straight and after 18 hours, I still had 58% life without running Power Save..Its a bit on the large side but I like the bigger screen.  It takes great pictures and its FAST!!!Its a bit heavy, but no more so than my Evo with the extended battery..Its well worth it, in my opinion..

Reviews.Title: HTC ONE MAX IS THE ONE MAGNIFICENT
Reviews.Author: Suzette Smith
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT. FAST BEAUTIFUL MAGNIFICENTThis the best phablet I have ever used.Build Quality is second to none, screenIs crisp vibrant absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: best phone ever
Reviews.Author: lady loved
Reviews.Content: This phone is so nice .  It always turn heads because it's so huge...The battery life is great I charge my phone every other day, during the day time...never overnight.. I love the fingerprint unlock feature... I never have to try more than twice before it reads my finger...You can watch movies on this phone with no problem..WiFi works the best...I use my phone for a remote for my TV..love that.always had the galaxy phones..but this is the best phone I have ever had....

Reviews.Title: More than just a good phone.
Reviews.Author: Henry Smith
Reviews.Content: I really like the new HTC ONE Max overall, but there at least two things I would have done differently. First I would relocate the power button; it's current location causes inadvertent powerings on and off; and second, for the music lover(which I assume this phone was designed for)I'd add some EQ options as well as a cutoff or sleep timer to the music player settings. Overall I think it's a really good phone. easy to use, and easy to love.

Reviews.Title: Give it a shot
Reviews.Author: SZE
Reviews.Content: Definitely different from what the photos seem like on the internet. The phone is quite a looker. Without feeling clunky and chunky, the phone feels incredible in the hand. The screen is also absolutely gorgeous. Yea you can argue it doesn't have top of the line processor, but android and HTC sense has made that a non-issue. The speed is great. I have had this phone for 3 months and the entertainment value + battery life makes everything worth it. I watch netflix on my phone everyday. The boomsound speakers are even louder than the HTCOne's. Incredible. Don't get tricked by crappy photos of this phone.

Reviews.Title: Very happy customer
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I've had the phone for six months now and I am very pleased with the results. I've mastered the finger scanning technique and speakers matched by no other. HTC has also improved with timely updates.

Reviews.Title: Great Phablet!
Reviews.Author: EC
Reviews.Content: I'd been studying on getting a new phone for months and seeing this one was the icebreaker.I did extensive research on this phone and compared it to others - especially the Galaxy Note 3.  Although the Note 3 appeared a step above in several features & characteristics, the HTC shined in most all other attributes.  So, I stayed true to my brand loyalty - especially after toting HTC's wonderful EVO 4G for three years.  I just knew I'd be happier with their product again.I use my smart phone mostly for browsing, emails and for portable entertainment.  The dual front-facing speakers were my final convincing feature that I wanted.  YES...they're pretty awesome!On the other hand, I don't do allot of phone calls and I'll admit that this phone is a bit awkward to hold when actually used as a PHONE.  SO, if you talk much on the phone, that may be a deterrent to your choosing this phone.I purchased the One Max through Amazon without ever actually seeing anything other than pictures of it.  I'd suggest NOT doing that and, instead, try it out first at your local store.  I say that only because its size may be a bit too much for some people.  It took a minute for me to get used to how big it is.  It dwarfs that old EVO.  That's funny, considering that the EVO was the largest on the market when I got it.My phone service is through Sprint.  After some price comparing, I made my purchase through Amazon and saved well over half the cost that Sprint was advertising on their website.  I also bought an Otter Box case w/holster, which significantly adds to its mass.  However, it's really not an issue to carry when strapped to my belt.  But...you'll know its there for sure.Final note:  The other day a friend who sports a Galaxy Note 3 asked to see my HTC to compare the two.  So, with the Note 3 in one hand and the HTC One Max in the other, it took all of three seconds to say "I gotta have that HTC as my next phone!"

Reviews.Title: Love The Phone with minor aggravations
Reviews.Author: ore
Reviews.Content: First, let's get this out of the way...Amazon customer service is TERRIFIC and so are the prices. They have been very responsive to me requests. I will keep shopping with them for a long time to come.Now the phone. My phone is my mp3, alarm, clock, radio, web browser, flashlight, gps, source for news, and did I mention...my phone. So before I purchased this phone, I read a lot of reviews and watch several reviewers on youtube. Some reviewers took points off because the phone, they claim, was too large. That's like marrying someone fulling knowing that they are very tall, large, or very short, and then complaining about it. Why would you do that? You know going in before you inked the deal what you were getting in to. If you didn't want a large phone, you won't have gotten one. So, hopefully, if you are like me, part of the reason why you want or purchased this phone is because it has a large AND beautiful screen. Watching movies, surfing the net, and videos is a REAL treat.Then others take point off because the processor is not as fast as the latest and greatest. Can I ask you a question? Can you notice any difference in the performance? I sure can't. This phone is lightning fast. Also, the hardware is beautiful. Nothing including Samsung comes close. The battery lasts a LONG time. For me, probably a day and half of quite a bit of use. I like the fact that the UI is not as bloated as Samsung's.What has me aggravated is that the LED notification light is now working at all. There is an androidforum blog of people having the same problem with the HTC one. Some have fixed this with a hard reboot and then reinstalling all the apps one at a time. I don't want to nor do I feel I should have to do that on a NEW phone. HTC needs to come up with a fix. Second, I have not been able to locate an FM tuner. I wanted that so I could "tune" it to the television in my gym while I worked out.If you are willing to overlook some of these irritations, and you want a beautiful phone with a great screen, speakers, long battery life, at a lesser price than a Note 3, this is your phone.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone.
Reviews.Author: Ranju Mathew
Reviews.Content: I love this phone because of the screen size, display quality, sound, responsiveness, infrared emitter, and fingerprint authentication.  I read a lot of reviews before I purchased it and I've had a lot of different smartphones(BlackBerry, iPhone 3g, Galaxy Epic, S2, S3) and this is by far my favorite.  A lot of people complain about the power button being in the side.  It is perfectly placed so you can hold the phone screen up in your palm and press the power button while sliding your index finger on the fingerprint scanner.  The scanner is really close to the camera and you can mistakenly smudge your camera.  I use the TUDIA Ultraslim Melody TPU case with this phone and I've grown accustomed to the feel of the case and cutouts.  Now I rarely smudge the camera.  The fingerprint scanner is fast and responsive.  I am usually able to unlock the phone on the first try and even if I had to try a few times, it is still faster than putting in my pin or password.  The only thing I didn't like about the phone was the placement of the home and back buttons.  I wished they followed convention with other android phones, but its easy to get the hang of after a week or so.  Other than that, the display is awesome, the sound is amazing for a phone, and the OS, apps and GUI are responsive and reliable.  I would recommend this phone to anyone that doesn't require multiwindow or stylus support.  Those are features that I rarely used on my tablet, so I don't really need them on my phone.

Reviews.Title: love my htc one max
Reviews.Author: ElyDi
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the best phones ever! With my old phone I dud not had good signal inside of my house! Since I have this phone I haven't miss a call! I love how long the battery last and also how fast this phone work! I'm not a patient person so I hate waiting while the page loads, but I'm very pleased with this phone! I wish it was little smaller, but is ok tho!

None of other phone can beat its quality of the sound. The function and quality of the pictures taken by the camera is much better than my friend's sony phone, iphone..

Reviews.Content: As a phone: it is big.  Obnoxiously big.As a pocket ebook reader/media device it is perfect.  The size is so large that the wallet case I got for it fits cash perfectly (a nice side effect).  The screen is flat gorgeous.

Reviews.Content: I love it.  The screen is huge.  The features are many.  It is very easy to operate.  I upgraded from the HTC EVO.  I highly recommend this phone

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone! Fast processor, metal skin, great camera. Amazon is the place to buy a phone!

Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best deal on this phone which included 2 day free shipping and a 7 day price guarantee that no one else even Sprint could match. The phone has one of the latest and greatest processors and the latest version of Android. Gorilla glass and front speakers top it off as the best of the biggies in my book.

Reviews.Title: Good phone

Reviews.Content: Good phone but big  if you used for phone that is to big for picture and video that is good

Reviews.Title: Did you like the One? Then you'll love the One Max!
Reviews.Author: john zrna
Reviews.Content: I have always been an HTC fan from my first Evo.These phones are very comfortable, functional, and ...let's face it,valuable!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: angie
Reviews.Content: i bought it for my teenager and i personally love it and i recommend to anyone that is looking for a cell with a big screen

Reviews.Title: Overall very good phone/tablet
Reviews.Author: Darrell Cole
Reviews.Content: My recent upgrade from the HTC EVO 4G LTEGood:Large and hi-def screenBoomSound (Fantastic and immersive speakers)Aluminum finishSuper simple transfer (I had another HTC phone before this)Decent battery life (I get a 1.5+ day out of it with normal use and Power saver on)FM antennaBlinkFeed can be turned off (I use it and like it)Customizable notification drawer for settings, wifi, mobile, etc.SD Card slotInternational phone if you need it to beSprint Spark supportBad:Adjustment period due to large size (I have fairly large hands but others may have a little trouble with the grip)Plastic at the corners can ding easily (A good case can fix that)Camera needs a few more megapixels (Though I later adjusted some settings and is now producing much better pictures)A bit heavier than your normal phoneThe warning screen every time GPS is turned on or off (The back button will send you back to your previous program, but it's still annoying)For the life of me, I can't figure out how to permanently turn off wifi (it searches even when it is 'turned off')Ugly:No black optionNearly impossible level of privacyFingerprint works for me but is in a slightly awkward positionBig bezels make the phone larger than it actually is (or should be)No kickstand (Cases with it are ungainly)The entire back comes off in the name of ergonomicsThe NFC logo on the notification bar (I use it a lot for my NFC tags, speakers and Google Wallet purchases, so it's somewhat annoying to see it permanently affixed on my bar)Your friends' reactions (especially if they're overly sarcastic like mine)

Reviews.Title: BEST. PHONE. EVER!!
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: This phone is by far the best phone I've ever had, & I've had 5 other smart phones in the last 6 years.  It took a few days to get used to the size, but now I don't think anything of it.  This is the only phone I've ever had that I didn't have to charge overnight - the battery life is AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: I love my new phone
Reviews.Author: Shumeka K. Rainey
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. The size is great. I low have a tablet and phone all rolled into one. My only complaint is the way the pictures look. When you few them they appear to be extremely dull, bad lighten. However, if you forward the pics they look great in the other persons phone but I'm sure this is something I should be able to change in settings but I haven't figured out how. Last complaint is people complain they can't hear me good when I talk on it. The phone is bigso my mouth is mi where near the speaker when ttalking. However, with a little adjusting of the phone on each conversation I get my mouth close enough to the speaker.Things I love about the phone includes: amazingly loud speakers that allows me to hear the music over the shower or vacuum, the facebook home screen you can setup, how much easier it is to text, and of course the huge screen.

Reviews.Title: I got Maxed
Reviews.Author: George Pacion
Reviews.Content: 6 months ago I ordered the HTC One for my wife from Amazon. The very cool red one. After setting it up I knew I wanted one also but only bigger. I have fat clumsy fingers and most texts have to do over because I mess up. I wanted the big screen. I watched every YouTube review on this phone, went to the Sprint store and fondled one. I waited till upgrade time, March 1,and ordered one knowing full well the all new HTC debut was around the corner. I have one in hand and love it. Here's to living largePS: I also ordered the New HTC Stylus

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: ssantee
Reviews.Content: Just got my HTC one max in the mail yesterday. It's big, it's beautiful and it's powerful. Now I know it's not the fastest phone out there but it is plenty powerful. Plays 1st person shooters with zero lag. Have yet to have a problem with it being slow. The space is a big plus, I added an additional 32gb SD card in it as well. I have yet to find a way to transfer apps to the SD card, but you can set your photos to save to the card which will save space on your internal storage. Before you buy this understand that it is very big. I came from a galaxy s3 and the max dwarfs it. I think it will be fine after a little time with it, but it really is large. Fits fine in my relaxed fit jeans pocket, but I can see it being hard in some skinny jeans. Also the back removable panel is an absolute pain to put back on. The corner by the switch to pop it off doesn't like to go back to being flush with the phone and stay in place. Took me probably 5 minutes just to get it back in flush. Ridiculous, but I don't plan on removing the back often. Speakers are great, they don't get as loud as I was thinking they would, but they are much louder than the s3's, so I'm very happy. Still have to try the finger print scanner, so I'll update with that later.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Phone
Reviews.Author: Robert Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I first got the phone because I have never owned a large phone before.  I was really thinking, OMG What have I done.  I'm not going to admit this to anyone!!  A few days went by and I picked up my wifes phone and was just amazed at how small it felt compared to my HTC One Max.  Then, I realized, I am so glad I got this phone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: TJ1
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone for myself and it is everything to me lol!!!The sound is loud. It's a nice size. And it was affordable to say the least. The camera looks great.. the Interface is amazing..I am in love!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: DDWASH
Reviews.Content: Once again HTC did it again.  This is a very good phone.  I had this phone since November.  And so far it has met all my needs.

Reviews.Title: htc one max
Reviews.Author: vedesh lutchman
Reviews.Content: its a power house of a phone...for small phone users not for you...for people who like to game listen to music etc. this is the phione for you. amazon had great service in delivery etc... im am very pleased with this phone, it can do so much....

Reviews.Title: replaced my Galaxy S2
Reviews.Author: Robin Collins
Reviews.Content: My husbands contract was up and i had gotten the Note 3 a few months before, and he wanted something similar. after doing his research he decided to go with this phone rather then the Note 3 and so far hasn't regretted it at all the only real difference between the two (if you're in the debate) is the HTC One uses finger print recognition and doesn't have a stylus. ( i still love my Note 3 though) both have kick butt camera's and being a parent who is constantly on the go, i love the fact that the screen is large so you can pop on netflix or an ebook

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Michael A Brown
Reviews.Content: software is slightly buggy, but Ive made it work the screen size js excellent over all I like it,dwarfs the phone of others.

Reviews.Title: A decent alternative to the Note
Reviews.Author: IAmThePowerOfFriendship
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone in general. It's basically the internals of a Galaxy Note 2 with the chassis of an HTC one.The picture is excellent, the sound is awesome, both the headphones and phone speakers, and the battery life is phenomenal.I encountered a small problem with the power switch getting stuck and was able to fix it with some gentle prying and by lubricating the switch out with a small amount of rubbing alcohol.I would otherwise give it five stars.It's generally a really good phone but feels a little rushed through production.
